author: potuz
content: <@893667743830802434> raised the issue of builders revealing the proposers IP addresses, wonder if we should discuss this or try to address it directly.

author: quintuskilbourn
content:
I was under the impression that revealing proposer IP was a big deal. Can someone confirm? 

Yes, relays currently have the same interactions with proposers, but that’s different from the ePBS setting because relays are small in number and explicitly trusted by node operators whereas builders are supposed to be able to join permissionlessly

The absence of IP protection is relevant for two reasons:
* could be a security issue with DoS being the biggest concern (Id imagine)
* many (or at least me) have not considered designs which reveal the proposer IP. I actually had an idea shot down because of the IP leak problem. If we do allow ourselves to use a design that exposes proposer IP (or has some other way of dealing with it), then I don’t know if the full design space has been well explored.

author: potuz
content: One caveat is that validators don't **need** to expose their IP, only those that actively request from the builders directly

author: barnabemonnot
content: That assumption still seems to underpin some of the stated ePBS benefits, e.g., latency-wise it feels correct to think that direct proposer-builder connection <(less latency as) mev-boost < p2p in-protocol bids

author: potuz
content: Oh definitely, I'm not minimizing the danger here
